column5: White Christmas

My brother & I were kids in the 50's so the Christmas Story always brings back lotsa fun memories and is an absolute favorite of mine, but I haven't seen it around for a few years now.  Christmas Vacation is hilarious too, but my problem  is, I haven't got the patience to sit thru a 2 hour movie but I've seen about a dozen 15 minute clips so far this season so I think I've just about got the whole show covered this year  Last time I was in a movie theater was 1977 when Close Encounters came out
You should see your doctor   rudolph or charlie brown
Watching The Polar Express has become a yearly tradition with my little ones. Great movie.
No doubt, Christmas vacation, mainly because of Cousin "Pooper was full" Eddie (his character inspired 2 halloween costumes for me) and the rant by Clark about his boss. John Hughes was a genius.
definitely! One of my all time favourite Candy movies too.
1. A Christmas Carol (I've seen like 10 different versions, it's just a good story all around) 2. Home Alone 3. Christmas Vacation
SANTA CLAUS! http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6hbX_fRgzqk
1. A Christmas Story 2. Christmas Vacation 3. Christmas Carol (original)
The one with the Griswalds...hilarious!
Christmas Vacation The Grinch - with Carey Polar Xpress  All are must sees for me for this time of year
and everyone forgot about the best Christmas movie:      PLATOON
Right on---no contest!!!!

Christmas Vacation!!!! Merry Christmas, Merry Christmas, Merry Christmas, Kiss my A.....s, Kiss her A....s, Kiss his A....s..............  A great movie full of laughs, classic Chevy Chase. We saw Christmas Carol (the new animated version) and it was great but a bit much for my little ones (almost 5 and 3). Stuck to Dickens' original story line quite well.  And A Christmas Story, great movie. I never did get a Red Ryder BB gun for Christmas.

A Christmas Carol   Ditto,  My Family and I always watch it Christmas eve, and Also watch its a Wonderfull life. I think I could Quote every line from either movie from memory LOL...  "Are there no Prisons, Are there no work houses?" LOL!

I think Titanic is a great Christmas movie Just to let people know what cold water feels like Seriously though Hands down Planes Trains and Automoblies Steve and John together brings a tear to my eye.....
I love, in no particular order:  Home Alone, A Christmas Story, Bad Santa, Elf, Planes Trains and Automobiles and Santa Claus
Miracle on 34th Street  Splashhopper   PS..   I still believe in Santa.... but don't tell anyone... especially my 11 yr old daughter
It's a toss up between Home Alone and National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation...both classics!

Not many with the older spiritual shows.  Im surprised.  King of Kings is another fav.  I do like the,,,,  Wonderfull world and the Christmas story,Frosty,Charlie Brown,the Grinch (the old one,not Jim Careys.LOL aswell.  Not a big fan of the run off spoofs. IMO,there is no real meaning of the season.

A Christmas Story - cuz it reminds me of Christmas as a kid, except for sticking my tongue to a post.  It's a Wonderful Life - a real feel good story  Going My Way - for the great music  Not sure of the order but they're my staples.  JF

without a doubt A Christmas Story  when Ralphie helps with the flat tire... "OOOOOOHHHHHHH FUDGE!!!!!!! except i didnt really say fudge," then when his mom calls the mom of "the kid that told him" and u hear her beating him on the other end CLASSIC  its the only christmas movie i HAVE to watch  oh man, the pink bunny suit from his aunt, awesome  oh man, the major award, "fragile" must be italian  must.....see it.... now.....
For me,it,s ,,,,,,     BENHUR   Ok,commercials over,got to go.

haha Bad Santa, hands down!

A Christmas Carol  1947's starring Alistair Sim.   Second would be Elf with Will Farrell.

Sorry guys but my girls have to watch what I had to watch.I loved it.jimmy stewart damn I forgot the names of the movies.Oh and christmas carol(youll shoot your eye out with it)and stupid me after watching the movie,I licked the fence post too,dont be shy weve all done it.I was a kid then in the 70s.Sure go for it jokes and all,I still hear about it.

I grew up watching "A christmas story" and to this day I make my wife watch it (shes not a big fan).  I also stuck my tongue to a chisel when i was a kid building a snow fort, it was an awsome fort!  Merry Christmas!!!
A Christmas Carol  1947's starring Alistair Sim.    The best Christmas Carol movie.
If your refering to .........Its a Wonderful Life  I`ll poke both my eyes out if I ever have to watch that Movie again..
